alert.note: Alert for Bradley; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 1:03PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bradley and southwestern Polk Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 202 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Benton. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wildwood Lake, Parksville and Conasauga. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
